title: Protocol for Analyzing Cell Cycle Phases of Polyphenic Wings Using Flow Cytometry
procedures:
Step-By-Step Method Details
Step-By-Step Method Details
Dissection
Timing: 2 h
Pick the newly emerged long- and short-winged brown planthoppers, nymph undergoing the last molting and emerged. Make sure the brown planthoper is emerged in less than 5 min.
Place the insects in a Petri dish containing cold PBS. Under the stereoscope, use one tweezer to press against the abdomen of the brown planthopper, and the other removes wings and places them in a 1.5 mL centrifuge tube containing 200 μL PBS (Figure 1[href=https://www.wicell.org#fig1], Method Video S1[href=https://www.wicell.org#mmc1]).

Pre-treatment
Timing: 4 h
Tissue/cell separation: grind the prepared sample with a grinding pestle.
Critical: Use a new grinding pestle for each sample. Do not reuse the pestle to grind the sample to prevent contamination. Samples should be ground sufficiently. The sample should be ground for at least 10 s. Insufficient grinding affects the collection of cells when the sample is loaded onto the machine.
Cell sedimentation: place the ground sample in a refrigerated centrifuge for centrifugation (10,000 × g, 4°C, 3 min).
Cell fixation:
Discard the supernatant.
Add 200 μL, 70% ethanol drop by drop (stored at −20°C).
Place the sample on ice and fix for 1 h to ensure that the basic morphology of the cells does not change.
Cell sedimentation: Put the fixed sample into a refrigerated centrifuge and centrifuge for 3 min (10,000 × g, 4°C).

Permeabilization step:
Discard the supernatant.
Add 200 μL of PBS and 100 μL of 0.25% TritonX-100 respectively and mix well.
Leave it at 4°C for 10 min.
Note: A channel is formed in the surface of the cell to facilitate the subsequent entry of DAPI.
Cell sedimentation: put the sample into a refrigerated centrifuge and centrifuge for 3 min (10,000 × g, 4°C).
Nucleic acid staining:
Discard the supernatant.
Add 400 μL PBS and 2 μL DAPI fluorescent dye (excitation wavelength: 405 nm). (Troubleshooting 1[href=https://www.wicell.org#troubleshooting])
Note: DAPI binds strongly to DNA and emits fluorescence.
Observe under a fluorescence microscope after 30 min in the dark. Then load the samples, the liquid ratio can be adjusted according to the number of samples.
Cell Cycle Detection
Timing: 3 h
Before loading the samples, filter the sample with a 40 μm cell strainer.
Note: Prevent the sample from blocking the lines of the instrument. (Troubleshooting 2[href=https://www.wicell.org#troubleshooting])
Ready to use:
Check the sheath liquid barrel and waste liquid barrel to ensure that the liquid in both reservoirs is within the safe range.
Turn on the flow cytometer and open the software.
Start the flow cytometry process, use 2 mL of pure water to clean and preheat.
Name the sample, double-click the left button to set the channel used for the sample to PB450 (detection filter: 450 ± 45 nm), and select the appropriate channel according to the dyes used.
Set two dot plots (FSC-A, SSC-A), (PB450-A, PB450-H) and one bar graph (PB450-A, COUNT). Change the format of the graph to linear.
Set the first scatter plot FSC-A/SSC-A to circle the cell population;

Doublet discrimination should be performed. Set up a second scatter plot of PB450 height signal and area signal to remove doublets, and the cell population with the same area signal and height signal is a single cell population;
Finally, the PB450 histogram is used to analyze the cycle status of the single cell population.
Sample loading, the number of collected particles is uniformly set at 3,000, which can be adjusted according to the number of effective particles. Save the data after the sample loading, and finally perform cleaning to end the program. (Troubleshooting 3, 4[href=https://www.wicell.org#troubleshooting]) (Figure 2[href=https://www.wicell.org#fig2]).

Cell Cycle Analysis
Timing: 2 h
Open the third-party software FlowJo and open the sample data in fcs format.
Identify valid cells:
Set the first gate: (FSC-H, SSC-H) to delineate the cell population.
Note: This step is to remove excessive cell debris.
Set a second gate: (PB450-A, FSC-W) to delineate the single cell population.
Using “cell cycle” in “Tools” to quantify the percentage of G1, S, G2/M, and a histogram was added in FlowJo.
